alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Cherokee; Houston; Trinity (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 10:34AM CDT until March 26 at 10:36AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Texas... Neches River Near Alto affecting Cherokee, Houston, Anderson and Trinity Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following river in Texas... Neches River Near Diboll affecting Tyler, Houston, Angelina, Polk and Trinity Counties. For the Neches River...including Alto, Diboll...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neches River Near Alto, Texas. * WHEN...Until late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16 feet, Boat ramps and picnic areas near the river will begin to flood. Ranchers should move cattle and equipment near the river to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 16.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM CDT Thursday was 16.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this Thursday evening and continue falling to 8.8 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 16 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued this morning at 1145 AM CDT.
